description: Add a Team Analysis and Explainability Panel that surfaces threat coverage, shield scenarios, core breakers, and per-Pokemon contribution to improve competitive team decisions.

userStories.title: Include analysis payload in generation response
userStories.description: As a frontend developer, I want analysis included in the generation response as a separate field so the UI can render immediately without a second request.
acceptanceCriteria: Generation API response includes a separate top-level `analysis` field
Existing generated team fields remain backward-compatible and unchanged
Analysis payload is structurally independent from `team` and `fitness` fields
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: Compute top-50 threat analysis and severity model
userStories.description: As a user, I want threat analysis based on the top 50 ranked threats so I can identify realistic matchup risks.
acceptanceCriteria: Threat analysis evaluates exactly the top 50 ranked threats
Each threat includes number of team answers and severity tier
Severity increases for higher-ranked threats
Threats ranked >100 reduce severity tier
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: Classify and rank core breakers by team size rules
userStories.description: As a user, I want explicit core breaker identification so I can quickly see matchups that collapse team reliability.
acceptanceCriteria: Team size 3: core breaker classification applies when answers <= 1
Team size 6: core breaker classification applies when answers <= 2
High severity applies for team size 3 when answers = 0
High severity applies for team size 6 when answers <= 1
Core breakers are sorted by best (highest) threat rank first
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: Expose shield scenario statistics
userStories.description: As a user, I want 0-0, 1-1, and 2-2 shield scenario stats so I can evaluate team consistency under common battle states.
acceptanceCriteria: Analysis includes `0-0`, `1-1`, and `2-2` shield scenario statistics
Shield scenario statistics are available in response data for UI rendering
Missing matchup data does not break analysis generation
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: Display analysis summary stats panel
userStories.description: As a PvP player, I want summary analysis metrics so I can quickly decide whether to use or reject a generated team.
acceptanceCriteria: Results page displays summary statistics for overall fitness, threat handling, shield stability, and core-breaker risk
Summary works consistently for both `individual` and `teamSynergy` algorithms
No formulas or algorithm internals are shown
Legend text explains the meaning of displayed statistics
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Render fitness contribution categories without formulas
userStories.description: As a user, I want category-level contribution stats so I can understand strengths and weaknesses without seeing internal scoring formulas.
acceptanceCriteria: Analysis UI shows category-level impact values that indicate positive or negative contribution
UI does not expose formulas, coefficients, or algorithm implementation details
Legend includes concise technical definitions for each category
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add accordion-based drill-down sections
userStories.description: As a user, I want expandable analysis sections so I can scan key stats first and dive deeper only when needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Analysis panel is organized into accordion sections with detailed areas collapsed by default
Sections support keyboard interaction and proper accessible semantics
Accordion behavior follows the provided component interaction pattern
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Show per-Pokemon contribution and rationale
userStories.description: As a user, I want each Pokemon's contribution and rationale so I can understand selection tradeoffs and replacement risk.
acceptanceCriteria: Each selected Pokemon shows contribution statistics and technical rationale
Detail includes coverage added and risk/fragility implications
Per-Pokemon details are accessible through accordion drill-down
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
